N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 473.5 - Decreases in maximum gross weight or unloaded weight

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 502
(a) In the event of a decrease in the maximum
gross weight or unloaded weight of any motor vehicle, an application may be
made for a corrected permit. However, any such application except an
application to cancel a permit, may be made only during the month of January. An application to cancel a permit on the basis of a decrease in the maximum
gross weight or unloaded weight of any motor vehicle may be made in any
month. (b) A request for an amended
permit in such case must be made to the State Tax Commission, Miscellaneous Tax

Bureau, by letter. This request must contain the carrier's name, address, employer identification number (but if the carrier has no employer
identification number, then the carrier's social security account number), the
permit number assigned by the Miscellaneous Tax Bureau to the vehicle which is
to be revised, and the new maximum gross weight or unloaded weight of the
vehicle involved. Upon approval thereof, an amended permit will be completed by
the bureau and issued without further charge. The old permit should not be
surrendered until the validated amended permit is received by the applicant, but the latter will not become effective until the superseded permit is
surrendered to the State Tax Commission. (c) The new maximum gross weight or unloaded
weight set forth in the application is subject to audit by the
commission. (d) An application for
the cancellation of a permit, resulting from a decrease in the maximum gross
weight or unloaded weight of a vehicle, may be made in any month. Notes
